definition[0]: if an industry, company, activity etc is in the doldrums, it is not doing well or developing
example[0]: Recent economic doldrums have damaged the rural west.
example[1]: The property market has been in the doldrums for months.
definition[1]: if you are in the doldrums, you are feeling sad
example[2]: Fay is in the doldrums today.
definition[2]: if an industry or market is in the doldrums, there is very little increase in prices or very little trade taking place
example[3]: The mortgage market has been in the doldrums for three years but now business is picking up.
